com.vdom.comms

Enum Event.EType

    public static enum Event.EType
extends java.lang.Enum<Event.EType>

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • GETSERVER

        public static final Event.EType GETSERVER
        GETSERVER Prompt the opposing side to send a SERVER message, containing its host and port.
        Apparently this used to be used by GameActivity.

      • SERVER

        public static final Event.EType SERVER
        SERVER Reply to GETSERVER, generated inside Comms.java. Gives information about the senders hostname and port.
        Yes, this is pointless.

      • HELLO

        public static final Event.EType HELLO
        HELLO

        Sent from GameActivity to RemotePlayer upon connecting to it. VDomServer also handles it. Would accept a NEWGAME or a GAMESTATS for an answer.
        VDomServer responds with GAMESTATS (and does nothing more)
        RemotePlayer responds with NEWGAME and updates its own player name.

        GameActivity also handles this event and connects to the default VDomServer port, sending it a HELLO. This event may be sent from JoinGameDialog.

      • GAMESTATS

        public static final Event.EType GAMESTATS
        GAMESTATS Sent from VDomServer upon receiving a HELLO or STARTGAME message.

      • NEWGAME

        public static final Event.EType NEWGAME
        NEWGAME Sent from RemotePLayer upon receiving HELLO from GameActivity.

      • STARTGAME

        public static final Event.EType STARTGAME
        STARTGAME GameActivity sends this to itself to cause it to connect to VDomServer. Then it sends it on to VDomServer. VDomServer reacts to it by creating a vdom-thread

      • JOINGAME

        public static final Event.EType JOINGAME
        JOINGAME

        Sent from JoinGameDialog to GameActivity and causes it to connect to a RemotePlayer (or, in principle, a VDomServer would be possible).

        GameActivity receives GAMESTATS from VDomServer, and with it a list of RemotePlayer instances it can connect to. JoinGameDialog (Which the user only gets to see if there is actually a choice of player seats to join) generates the information about available RemotePlayer instances.

      • STATUS

        public static final Event.EType STATUS
        STATUS Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity, informing it about the current status of the game. It has the EventObject::GameStatus parameter set. This is sent from RemotePlayer
        1. Whenever a game-event happened (message from vdom), unless a CARDOBTAINED, CARDTRASHED, or CARDREVEALED is sent
        2. Whenever GameActivity is asked for a response it is first updated about the game state with this

        needs EType.Success ack

      • GETNAME

        public static final Event.EType GETNAME
        GETNAME NOT USED

      • SETNAME

        public static final Event.EType SETNAME
        SETNAME NOT USED

      • SETHOST

        public static final Event.EType SETHOST
        SETHOST Tells GameActivity to start a game with the given RemotePlayer-host. Sent from HostDialog.java

      • GETCARD

        public static final Event.EType GETCARD
        GETCARD Sent from RemotePlayer when the player needs to choose cards.

        needs EType.CARD response

      • CARD

        public static final Event.EType CARD
        CARD Sent from GameTable to GameActivity, which forwards it to RemotePlayer, as a response to GETCARD.

      • GETSTRING

        public static final Event.EType GETSTRING
        GETSTRING Sent from RemotePlayer when the player needs to enter a string. This is the prompt of what option of an action card to perform.

        needs EType.STRING response

      • STRING

        public static final Event.EType STRING
        STRING Sent from SelectStringView to GameActivity, which forwards it to RemotePlayer, as a response to GetString.

      • ORDERCARDS

        public static final Event.EType ORDERCARDS
        ORDERCARDS Sent from RemotePlayer when the player needs to put cards in an order (to put them on the deck mainly)

        needs EType.CARDORDER response

      • CARDORDER

        public static final Event.EType CARDORDER
        CARDORDER Sent from OrderCardsView to GameActivity, which forwards it to RemotePlayer, as a response to ORDERCARDS.

      • CARDOBTAINED

        public static final Event.EType CARDOBTAINED
        CARDOBTAINED Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity when a new card was obtained.

        needs EType.Success ack

      • CARDTRASHED

        public static final Event.EType CARDTRASHED
        CARDTRASHED Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity when a card was trashed.

        needs EType.Success ack

      • CARDREVEALED

        public static final Event.EType CARDREVEALED
        CARDREVEALED Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity when a card was revealed.

        needs EType.Success ack

      • SAY

        public static final Event.EType SAY
        SAY Broadcast a chat message. When GameActivity receives this (from TalkView), it forwards it to RemotePlayer. VDomServer then causes all remote players to send back a CHAT message.

      • CHAT

        public static final Event.EType CHAT
        CHAT Sent to GameActivity to display a chat message.

      • Success

        public static final Event.EType Success
        Success Sent as ack-signal from GameActivity to RemotePlayer.

      • QUIT

        public static final Event.EType QUIT
        QUIT Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity when the game was quit. (Via function sendQuit() which is called by RemotePlayer). This causes GameActivity to disconnect and ignore DISCONNECT messages until it connects again with some other server.

      • ACHIEVEMENT

        public static final Event.EType ACHIEVEMENT
        ACHIEVEMENT Sent from RemotePlayer to GameActivity upon receiving an achievement.

      • DEBUG

        public static final Event.EType DEBUG
        DEBUG Handled by GameActivity

      • PING

        public static final Event.EType PING
        PING Request a PONG or disconnect. PING is caused by Comms.java whenever the receiving socket timed out (pretty often). If the other party does not answer with PONG (this may be because of a race condition...), handle a received DISCONNECT event and terminate the network threads.

      • PONG

        public static final Event.EType PONG
        PONG Comms.java replies this automatically to a PING message.

      • DISCONNECT

        public static final Event.EType DISCONNECT
        DISCONNECT Sent from Comms.java when a PING failed. Causes GameActivity to display the "Connection Lost" message, VDomServer to reset its listening port, and RemotePlayer to do nothing.

      • KILLSENDER

        public static final Event.EType KILLSENDER
        KILLSENDER Used internally by Domms: causes the sendingThread to shut down and the receiving thread to return null once

      • SLEEP

        public static final Event.EType SLEEP
        SLEEP Make the receiving thread sleep for the amount of time

    System.out.println(c);
